page.title: 13Royston Police Station
page.content: Royston police station has been in the same building on Priory Lane for 103 years. The police used to have horses, but now the stables have become the police car park. The police station has a magistrates' court next door, where people are tried. Three magistrates sit at a long table. Sometimes people are kept in one of the cells, which are old and dark.In each cell there is a bed and a rock- hard pillow made of wood. The police deal with everything from lost property to an occasional murder. They have a new computerised breath- alyser machine to test drunk drivers. The police patrol the streets and help people. They catch shop-lifters and burglars. They go all over Royston and the villages to the south, but not into Cambridgeshire, because that is a different county.
